title: AC not cooling at all
symptoms: Room stays warm even after AC runs for long time
Air coming from vents is not cold
Thermostat set to cool but no temperature drop
possible_causes: Low or no refrigerant due to leak
recommended_actions: Verify thermostat is set to COOL and temperature is lower than room temp
Clean outdoor condenser coils with soft brush or low-pressure water
Check if outdoor fan and compressor are running; listen for humming or clicking
If coils are clean and compressor does not start, call a certified HVAC technician to check refrigerant level and compressor health

title: AC cooling weak or uneven
symptoms: AC cools a little but never reaches set temperature
Some rooms colder than others
Airflow feels weak at some vents
recommended_actions: Check and replace dirty air filter (usually every 1–3 months)
Make sure supply and return vents are open and not blocked by furniture
Inspect visible duct sections for loose joints or insulation gaps
If airflow is fine but cooling still weak, schedule technician to check refrigerant and system capacity

title: AC not turning on
symptoms: Thermostat shows call for cooling but system does not start
No sound from indoor or outdoor unit
Breaker may be tripped
possible_causes: Tripped circuit breaker or blown fuse
Thermostat batteries dead or wrong settings
Blown control fuse on air handler board
recommended_actions: Check breaker panel and reset any tripped AC breakers once
Replace thermostat batteries and confirm mode is set to COOL
Ensure the service switch near indoor unit is in ON position
If system still dead, call technician to test low-voltage circuit and safety switches

title: Outdoor unit not running
symptoms: Indoor blower runs and blows warm air
Outdoor condenser fan and compressor silent
Buzzing or clicking sound at outdoor unit
recommended_actions: Check outdoor disconnect box and reset if tripped (if safe and allowed)
Listen for humming; if present but fan does not spin, turn OFF power and call technician (possible capacitor failure)
Do not repeatedly force-start the unit; this can damage compressor
Schedule HVAC professional to inspect electrical components and compressor

title: Indoor blower runs but no airflow from vents
symptoms: You hear indoor fan, but little or no air comes out
Evaporator section may be iced over
Return grille may sound restricted
possible_causes: Frozen evaporator coil due to low airflow or low refrigerant
recommended_actions: Turn system OFF and inspect air filter; replace if dirty
Let any ice on evaporator coil melt completely (may take several hours)
After thawing, run FAN-ONLY for 15–30 minutes to dry coil
If icing returns, call technician to check refrigerant charge and airflow design

title: AC short cycling (turns on and off frequently)
symptoms: AC starts and stops every few minutes
Room never reaches comfortable temperature
Compressor clicking on and off
possible_causes: Low refrigerant or high-pressure safety trips
Faulty thermostat placement near vent or window
recommended_actions: Clean or replace air filter and ensure vents are not blocked
Visually inspect outdoor unit for debris and clean coils if dirty
Check thermostat location; avoid direct sunlight or supply air
If short cycling continues, call technician to check refrigerant, pressure switches, and sizing

title: Water leaking from indoor unit
symptoms: Water dripping from air handler or ceiling
Wet spots around indoor unit
AC stops suddenly and may show float-switch error
possible_causes: Improper unit leveling causing water to overflow
recommended_actions: Turn system OFF to prevent ceiling damage
Locate condensate drain line and gently clear blockage using wet/dry vacuum at outside end if accessible
Check if drain pan is cracked or overflowing
If leak persists or pan is damaged, call HVAC or plumber for repair

title: Water dripping from outdoor unit
symptoms: Puddle of water near outdoor condenser
Occurs mainly in humid weather
No obvious performance issue
possible_causes: Normal condensation from refrigerant lines or coil
Defrost water from heat-pump mode in winter
Clogged or misrouted drain from indoor unit
recommended_actions: Observe water; light dripping during hot, humid days can be normal
Check that refrigerant lines are insulated and not icing over
If water is excessive, muddy, or coming from cabinet joints, schedule inspection

title: Bad smell when AC runs
symptoms: Musty, moldy, or sour smell from vents
Burning or electrical odor when unit starts
Smell worse in certain rooms
possible_causes: Mold or mildew in evaporator coil or drain pan
Pest or dead animal in duct
recommended_actions: Replace air filter and run FAN-ONLY for 30 minutes
Inspect drain pan and drain line for standing water and clean if safe
If burning or chemical smell, turn OFF system immediately and call technician
Consider professional coil cleaning and duct inspection if odor persists

title: Unusual noises from indoor unit
symptoms: Rattling, banging, or scraping noise from air handler
High-pitched squeal during startup
Intermittent clicking or tapping
possible_causes: Loose blower wheel or mounting screws
Worn blower motor bearings or belt
recommended_actions: Turn OFF system to avoid further damage
Remove front panel (if safe) and visually inspect for loose panels or objects
Tighten accessible screws that clearly hold panels, not electrical components
If noise continues, schedule technician to service motor and blower assembly

title: Unusual noises from outdoor unit
symptoms: Grinding, buzzing, or rattling from condenser
Fan blade hitting something
Loud humming but fan not spinning
possible_causes: Fan blade bent and hitting shroud
recommended_actions: Turn OFF power at disconnect before inspecting
Remove visible debris with gloved hand or tool
Do not attempt to bend fan blades aggressively; call technician if misaligned
If fan does not start and motor just hums, call HVAC pro to replace capacitor or motor

title: Ice on refrigerant lines or outdoor unit
symptoms: Frost or ice on copper lines near outdoor or indoor unit
Reduced airflow and weak cooling
Water around indoor unit after thawing
possible_causes: Low airflow due to dirty filter or blocked vents
Running AC in very cold outdoor temperatures
recommended_actions: Turn system OFF and switch thermostat fan to ON to melt ice
Replace dirty filter and verify all vents are open
Avoid running AC when outdoor temperature is below manufacturer limit
If ice returns, call technician to check for refrigerant leaks

title: Thermostat not responding correctly
symptoms: Display blank or flickering
Room temperature reading clearly wrong
AC does not follow programmed schedule
possible_causes: Thermostat mounted near heat source or supply vent
recommended_actions: Replace batteries and check that breaker is ON
Ensure thermostat cover is firmly in place so safety switch is pressed
Confirm thermostat not in direct sun or near lamps
If problems persist, consider replacing thermostat or calling technician

title: High energy bills with normal usage
symptoms: Electric bill suddenly higher with same comfort settings
AC runs longer cycles than before
Home never feels quite comfortable
possible_causes: Dirty coils and filters reducing efficiency
recommended_actions: Clean or replace filter and ensure outdoor unit is free from debris
Seal visible duct leaks with mastic or foil tape (not cloth duct tape)
Use programmable thermostat to avoid over-cooling
Schedule professional maintenance and performance check

title: Breaker for AC keeps tripping
symptoms: Breaker trips when AC starts or after short run
You must reset breaker often
AC may hum then stop
possible_causes: Oversized breaker or wrong wire size from past work
Dirty filters or coils causing motor overload
recommended_actions: Do not repeatedly reset breaker; this can be a fire risk
Turn thermostat OFF and leave breaker off until inspected
Clean filters and coils if safe, but still call licensed electrician or HVAC technician to diagnose electrical load and wiring

title: Airflow strong but air not cold
symptoms: Fan blows strongly yet air temperature barely drops
Outdoor unit may be running continuously
Lines at outdoor unit not very cold
recommended_actions: Verify doors/windows are closed and blinds lowered to reduce load
Check outdoor unit for ice or strange noises
Call HVAC technician for refrigerant pressure and valve diagnostics; do not attempt to add refrigerant yourself

title: Air feels humid and sticky indoors
symptoms: Home cool but still uncomfortable and clammy
Windows may show condensation
AC cycles are very short
possible_causes: Oversized AC system removing little moisture
Fan set to ON instead of AUTO causing re-evaporation
recommended_actions: Set thermostat fan mode to AUTO
Replace filter and schedule coil cleaning
Use standalone dehumidifier in very humid climates
Consult HVAC pro about sizing or two-stage/variable-speed options

title: Some rooms too cold, others too warm
symptoms: Temperature difference between rooms
Far rooms get little airflow
People adjust vents manually often
possible_causes: Closed dampers or crushed flex duct
recommended_actions: Make sure supply and return vents are open in problem rooms
Inspect visible ducts in attic or basement for kinks or loose connections
Consider simple balancing by partially closing vents in rooms that are too cold
For persistent issues, ask HVAC contractor for duct balancing or zoning options

title: AC blows warm air only during hottest hours
symptoms: Works early in day but struggles in afternoon
Outdoor unit very hot to touch
Breaker may trip on extreme days
possible_causes: Condenser coil overloaded with heat or dirty fins
recommended_actions: Shade outdoor unit if possible without blocking airflow
Clean condenser coil carefully from outside to inside
Reduce indoor heat load by closing blinds and avoiding oven use
Schedule performance evaluation to see if system size is adequate

title: AC runs continuously without shutting off
symptoms: System rarely cycles off even when room is cool
Thermostat temperature may be set low
Coils may be dirty
possible_causes: Thermostat set too low or faulty temperature sensor
Dirty coils or filter reducing capacity
Leaky home envelope letting heat in
recommended_actions: Increase thermostat setpoint by 1–2°C and see if unit cycles
Replace filter and clean outdoor unit
Check doors, windows, and weather-stripping for air leaks
If always running even at moderate weather, ask technician to check capacity and thermostat calibration

title: AC fan not running but compressor works
symptoms: Outdoor unit makes humming noise
Compressor housing vibrates but fan blades still
Air from indoor vents gets very little cooler over time
possible_causes: Fan blade physically stuck or obstructed
recommended_actions: Turn OFF power immediately to avoid compressor overheating
Visually inspect fan area for sticks or debris (with power OFF)
Do not push fan by hand with power on
Call HVAC professional to test capacitor and motor and replace as needed

title: Indoor fan not running but outdoor unit is
symptoms: Outdoor condenser runs normally
No air blowing from indoor vents
Evaporator coil may freeze into solid block of ice
possible_causes: Blown control fuse on air handler board
Loose wiring at blower relay or door switch
recommended_actions: Turn thermostat OFF to prevent ice damage
Check that air handler door is fully closed to engage safety switch
Inspect accessible fuses only if you are comfortable and power is OFF
Contact technician to test blower motor and control board

title: AC smells like burning plastic
symptoms: Sharp burning or plastic smell when unit runs
May coincide with breaker warmth or flicker
Odor strongest near indoor unit
possible_causes: Foreign object touching heater strips in air handler (for combo units)
recommended_actions: Turn OFF system and breaker immediately
Do not operate until inspected by qualified technician or electrician
Document when smell occurs (startup, continuous, only heat) to help diagnosis

title: AC produces whistling noise from vents
symptoms: High-pitched whistle when system runs
Noise changes when doors are opened
Occurs mainly at certain vents
possible_causes: Return duct undersized causing high negative pressure
recommended_actions: Replace or downgrade to manufacturer-recommended filter MERV rating
Open more supply vents, especially near noisy rooms
If problem persists, consult HVAC designer about return-air sizing

title: AC unit vibrates excessively
symptoms: Noticeable vibration or shaking of indoor or outdoor unit
Rattling noises transmitted through walls
Vibration worse at startup
possible_causes: Unit not level or placed on weak pad
Loose mounting bolts or fan imbalance
recommended_actions: Visually check that condenser pad is level and stable
Add rubber isolation pads if recommended by technician
Gently separate copper lines from walls using foam insulation (with care)
Have technician check fan balance and mounting hardware

title: Thermostat shows error or E-code
symptoms: Screen shows E1, E2, or similar error
System may not respond to commands
Occurs after power outage sometimes
possible_causes: Communication error between thermostat and indoor unit
recommended_actions: Turn OFF power to system for 5 minutes, then restore to reset electronics
Verify thermostat model matches system type (heat pump vs straight cool)
If error returns, photograph code and contact HVAC technician for manufacturer-specific diagnostics

title: AC freezes only at night
symptoms: Coils ice up during cooler night temperatures
Works better in daytime
Ice seen on suction line near outdoor unit
possible_causes: Running AC when outdoor temperature is too low
Very low airflow at night (closed doors, vents)
recommended_actions: Avoid operating AC when outdoor temps are below recommended minimum (often around 60°F / 16°C)
Keep interior doors and key vents open at night
If freezing continues, schedule refrigerant and airflow check

title: Heat pump stuck in heat or cool mode
symptoms: System continues to heat when set to cool or opposite
Outdoor unit may run in unexpected mode
Supply air temperature does not match demand
possible_causes: Thermostat configuration error for heat pump
recommended_actions: Confirm thermostat is correctly configured for HEAT PUMP system
Toggle system OFF then back to COOL after a few minutes pause
If unit still operates in wrong mode, call technician to test reversing valve

title: AC makes loud boom or bang at start
symptoms: Single boom sound when unit starts
Ducts may flex or pop
Usually no continuous noise afterward
possible_causes: Ductwork expansion due to high static pressure
Delayed air start from motor or damper
recommended_actions: Open more supply and return vents to lower static pressure
Ask HVAC tech to measure static pressure and inspect duct supports
Reinforce noisy duct sections with additional screws or bracing (by professional)

title: Smart thermostat disconnects from Wi-Fi or app
symptoms: Thermostat shows offline in mobile app
Local control works but remote access fails
Problem appears after router change
possible_causes: Wi-Fi signal weak at thermostat location
recommended_actions: Restart router and thermostat
Ensure thermostat is within good Wi-Fi range or add mesh node
Reconnect thermostat to updated SSID and password
Consult thermostat manufacturer support if issue continues
